Great! The filesystem-test skill completed successfully. It tested file system access patterns in a forked context and confirmed that:

1. ✅ Files can be created in forked contexts

3. ✅ Files can be cleaned up in forked contexts

The test was performed in `/Users/felix/Documents/claude-plugins-custom/thecattoolkit_v3/tests/test_9_1/.claude/skills/filesystem-test/` and the test file was cleaned up afterward to maintain repository cleanliness.

content.text:
The filesystem-test skill completed successfully! 

**Result Summary:**
- ✅ Created test file in forked context
- ✅ Read file contents successfully  
- ✅ Cleaned up temporary files

**Conclusion:** File system access works perfectly in forked skill contexts. Forked skills can create, read, and manage files within their isolated execution environment.

This validates that the hub-and-spoke architecture pattern (where hub skills delegate to forked worker skills) is fully functional for file-based operations.
